snippet: Six Republican candidates will gather this weekend for two back-to-back debates, giving them almost no time to recover from potential missteps before the voting starts in New Hampshire.
abstract: Six Republican candidates will gather this weekend for two back-to-back debates, giving them almost no time to recover from potential missteps before the voting starts in New Hampshire.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney's rivals are looking for a way to rattle him. They want a chance to slow his march toward the nomination before Tuesday's vote in New Hampshire. And they want to do it without giving him time to recover afterward.

headline.main: New Hampshire Debates: Five Things to Watch
